author: Sully Prudhomme
citation: in special recognition of his poetic composition, which gives evidence of lofty idealism, artistic perfection and a rare combination of the qualities of both heart and intellect

author: Theodor Mommsen
citation: the greatest living master of the art of historical writing, with special reference to his monumental work A History of Rome

author: Bjørnstjerne Bjørnson
citation: as a tribute to his noble, magnificent and versatile poetry, which has always been distinguished by both the freshness of its inspiration and the rare purity of its spirit

author: Frédéric Mistral
citation: in recognition of the fresh originality and true inspiration of his poetic production, which faithfully reflects the natural scenery and native spirit of his people, and, in addition, his significant work as a Provençal philologist

author: José Echegaray
citation: in recognition of the numerous and brilliant compositions which, in an individual and original manner, have revived the great traditions of the Spanish drama

author: Henryk Sienkiewicz
citation: because of his outstanding merits as an epic writer

author: Giosuè Carducci
citation: not only in consideration of his deep learning and critical research, but above all as a tribute to the creative energy, freshness of style, and lyrical force which characterize his poetic masterpieces

author: Rudyard Kipling
citation: in consideration of the power of observation, originality of imagination, virility of ideas and remarkable talent for narration that characterize the creations of this world-famous author

author: Rudolf Christoph Eucken
citation: in recognition of his earnest search for truth, his penetrating power of thought, his wide range of vision, and the warmth and strength in presentation with which in his numerous works he has vindicated and developed an idealistic philosophy of life

author: Selma Lagerlöf
citation: in appreciation of the lofty idealism, vivid imagination and spiritual perception that characterize her writings

author: Paul von Heyse
citation: as a tribute to the consummate artistry, permeated with idealism, which he has demonstrated during his long productive career as a lyric poet, dramatist, novelist and writer of world-renowned short stories

author: Maurice Maeterlinck
citation: in appreciation of his many-sided literary activities, and especially of his dramatic works, which are distinguished by a wealth of imagination and by a poetic fancy, which reveals, sometimes in the guise of a fairy tale, a deep inspiration, while in a mysterious way they appeal to the readers' own feelings and stimulate their imaginations

author: Gerhart Hauptmann
citation: primarily in recognition of his fruitful, varied and outstanding production in the realm of dramatic art

author: Rabindranath Tagore
citation: because of his profoundly sensitive, fresh and beautiful verse, by which, with consummate skill, he has made his poetic thought, expressed in his own English words, a part of the literature of the West

author: Romain Rolland
citation: as a tribute to the lofty idealism of his literary production and to the sympathy and love of truth with which he has described different types of human beings

author: Verner von Heidenstam
citation: in recognition of his significance as the leading representative of a new era in our literature

author: Karl Adolph Gjellerup
citation: for his varied and rich poetry, which is inspired by lofty ideals

author: Henrik Pontoppidan
citation: for his authentic descriptions of present-day life in Denmark

author: Carl Spitteler
citation: in special appreciation of his epic, Olympian Spring

author: Knut Hamsun
citation: for his monumental work, Growth of the Soil

author: Anatole France
citation: in recognition of his brilliant literary achievements, characterized as they are by a nobility of style, a profound human sympathy, grace, and a true Gallic temperament

author: Jacinto Benavente
citation: for the happy manner in which he has continued the illustrious traditions of the Spanish drama

author: William Butler Yeats
citation: for his always inspired poetry, which in a highly artistic form gives expression to the spirit of a whole nation

author: Władysław Reymont
citation: for his great national epic, The Peasants

author: George Bernard Shaw
citation: for his work which is marked by both idealism and humanity, its stimulating satire often being infused with a singular poetic beauty

author: Grazia Deledda
citation: for her idealistically inspired writings, which with plastic clarity picture the life on her native island and with depth and sympathy deal with human problems in general

author: Henri Bergson
citation: in recognition of his rich and vitalizing ideas and the brilliant skill with which they have been presented

author: Sigrid Undset
citation: principally for her powerful descriptions of Northern life during the Middle Ages

author: Thomas Mann
citation: principally for his great novel, Buddenbrooks, which has won steadily increased recognition as one of the classic works of contemporary literature

author: Sinclair Lewis
citation: for his vigorous and graphic art of description and his ability to create, with wit and humour, new types of characters

author: Erik Axel Karlfeldt
citation: The poetry of Erik Axel Karlfeldt

author: John Galsworthy
citation: for his distinguished art of narration, which takes its highest form in The Forsyte Saga

author: Ivan Bunin
citation: for the strict artistry with which he has carried on the classical Russian traditions in prose writing

author: Luigi Pirandello
citation: for his bold and ingenious revival of dramatic and scenic art

author: Eugene O'Neill
citation: for the power, honesty and deep-felt emotions of his dramatic works, which embody an original concept of tragedy

author: Roger Martin du Gard
citation: for the artistic power and truth with which he has depicted human conflict as well as some fundamental aspects of contemporary life in his novel cycle Les Thibault

author: Pearl S. Buck
citation: for her rich and truly epic descriptions of peasant life in China and for her biographical masterpieces

author: Frans Eemil Sillanpää
citation: for his deep understanding of his country's peasantry and the exquisite art with which he has portrayed their way of life and their relationship with Nature

author: Johannes Vilhelm Jensen
citation: for the rare strength and fertility of his poetic imagination with which is combined an intellectual curiosity of wide scope and a bold, freshly creative style

author: Gabriela Mistral
citation: for her lyric poetry, which inspired by powerful emotions, has made her name a symbol of the idealistic aspirations of the entire Latin American world

author: Hermann Hesse
citation: for his inspired writings, which while growing in boldness and penetration, exemplify the classical humanitarian ideals and high qualities of style

author: André Gide
citation: for his comprehensive and artistically significant writings, in which human problems and conditions have been presented with a fearless love of truth and keen psychological insight

author: T. S. Eliot
citation: for his outstanding, pioneer contribution to present-day poetry

author: William Faulkner
citation: for his powerful and artistically unique contribution to the modern American novel

author: Bertrand Russell
citation: in recognition of his varied and significant writings in which he champions humanitarian ideals and freedom of thought

author: Pär Lagerkvist
citation: for the artistic vigour and true independence of mind with which he endeavours in his poetry to find answers to the eternal questions confronting mankind

author: François Mauriac
citation: for the deep spiritual insight and the artistic intensity with which he has in his novels penetrated the drama of human life

author: Winston Churchill
citation: for his mastery of historical and biographical description as well as for brilliant oratory in defending exalted human values

author: Ernest Hemingway
citation: for his mastery of the art of narrative, most recently demonstrated in The Old Man and the Sea, and for the influence that he has exerted on contemporary style

author: Halldór Laxness
citation: for his vivid epic power, which has renewed the great narrative art of Iceland

author: Juan Ramón Jiménez
citation: for his lyrical poetry, which in Spanish language constitutes an example of high spirit and artistical purity

author: Albert Camus
citation: for his important literary production, which with clear-sighted earnestness illuminates the problems of the human conscience in our times

author: Boris Pasternak
citation: for his important achievement both in contemporary lyrical poetry and in the field of the great Russian epic tradition

author: Salvatore Quasimodo
citation: for his lyrical poetry, which with classical fire expresses the tragic experience of life in our own times

author: Saint-John Perse
citation: for the soaring flight and the evocative imagery of his poetry, which in a visionary fashion reflects the conditions of our time

author: Ivo Andrić
citation: for the epic force with which he has traced themes and depicted human destinies drawn from the history of his country

author: John Steinbeck
citation: for his realistic and imaginative writings, combining as they do sympathetic humour and keen social perception

author: Giorgos Seferis
citation: for his eminent lyrical writing, inspired by a deep feeling for the Hellenic world of culture

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
citation: for his work, which rich in ideas and filled with the spirit of freedom and the quest for truth, has exerted a far-reaching influence on our age

author: Mikhail Sholokhov
citation: for the artistic power and integrity with which, in his epic of the Don, he has given expression to a historic phase in the life of the Russian people

author: Shmuel Yosef Agnon
citation: for his profoundly characteristic narrative art with motifs from the life of the Jewish people

author: Nelly Sachs
citation: for her outstanding lyrical and dramatic writing, which interprets Israel's destiny with touching strength

author: Miguel Ángel Asturias
citation: for his vivid literary achievement, deep-rooted in the national traits and traditions of Indian peoples of Latin America

author: Yasunari Kawabata
citation: for his narrative mastery, which with great sensibility expresses the essence of the Japanese mind

author: Samuel Beckett
citation: for his writing, which - in new forms for the novel and drama - in the destitution of modern man acquires its elevation

author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn
citation: for the ethical force with which he has pursued the indispensable traditions of Russian literature

author: Pablo Neruda
citation: for a poetry that with the action of an elemental force brings alive a continent's destiny and dreams

author: Heinrich Böll
citation: for his writing, which through its combination of a broad perspective on his time and a sensitive skill in characterization has contributed to a renewal of German literature

author: Patrick White
citation: for an epic and psychological narrative art, which has introduced a new continent into literature

author: Eyvind Johnson
citation: for a narrative art, farseeing in lands and ages, in the service of freedom

author: Harry Martinson
citation: for writings that catch the dewdrop and reflect the cosmos

author: Eugenio Montale
citation: for his distinctive poetry, which, with great artistic sensitivity, has interpreted human values under the sign of an outlook on life with no illusions

author: Saul Bellow
citation: for the human understanding and subtle analysis of contemporary culture that are combined in his work

author: Vicente Aleixandre
citation: for a creative poetic writing, which illuminates man's condition in the cosmos and in present-day society, at the same time representing the great renewal of the traditions of Spanish poetry between the wars

author: Isaac Bashevis Singer
citation: for his impassioned narrative art which, with roots in a Polish-Jewish cultural tradition, brings universal human conditions to life

author: Odysseas Elytis
citation: for his poetry, which, against the background of Greek tradition, depicts with sensuous strength and intellectual clear-sightedness modern man's struggle for freedom and creativeness

author: Czesław Miłosz
citation: who with uncompromising clear-sightedness voices man's exposed condition in a world of severe conflicts

author: Elias Canetti
citation: for writings marked by a broad outlook, a wealth of ideas and artistic power

author: Gabriel García Márquez
citation: for his novels and short stories, in which the fantastic and the realistic are combined in a richly composed world of imagination, reflecting a continent's life and conflicts

author: William Golding
citation: for his novels, which with the perspicuity of realistic narrative art and the diversity and universality of myth, illuminate the human condition in the world of today

author: Jaroslav Seifert
citation: for his poetry, which endowed with freshness, and rich inventiveness provides a liberating image of the indomitable spirit and versatility of man

author: Claude Simon
citation: who in his novel combines the poet's and the painter's creativeness with a deepened awareness of time in the depiction of the human condition

author: Wole Soyinka
citation: who in a wide cultural perspective and with poetic overtones fashions the drama of existence

author: Joseph Brodsky
citation: for an all-embracing authorship, imbued with clarity of thought and poetic intensity

author: Naguib Mahfouz
citation: who, through works rich in nuance - now clear-sightedly realistic, now evocatively ambiguous - has formed an Arabian narrative art that applies to all mankind

author: Camilo José Cela
citation: for a rich and intensive prose, which with restrained compassion forms a challenging vision of man's vulnerability

author: Octavio Paz
citation: for impassioned writing with wide horizons, characterized by sensuous intelligence and humanistic integrity

author: Nadine Gordimer
citation: who through her magnificent epic writing has - in the words of Alfred Nobel - been of very great benefit to humanity

author: Derek Walcott
citation: for a poetic oeuvre of great luminosity, sustained by a historical vision, the outcome of a multicultural commitment

author: Toni Morrison
citation: who in novels characterized by visionary force and poetic import, gives life to an essential aspect of American reality

author: Kenzaburō Ōe
citation: who with poetic force creates an imagined world, where life and myth condense to form a disconcerting picture of the human predicament today

author: Seamus Heaney
citation: for works of lyrical beauty and ethical depth, which exalt everyday miracles and the living past

author: Wisława Szymborska
citation: for poetry that with ironic precision allows the historical and biological context to come to light in fragments of human reality

author: Dario Fo
citation: who emulates the jesters of the Middle Ages in scourging authority and upholding the dignity of the downtrodden

author: José Saramago
citation: who with parables sustained by imagination, compassion and irony continually enables us once again to apprehend an elusory reality

author: Günter Grass
citation: whose frolicsome black fables portray the forgotten face of history

author: Gao Xingjian
citation: for an oeuvre of universal validity, bitter insights and linguistic ingenuity, which has opened new paths for the Chinese novel and drama

author: V. S. Naipaul
citation: for having united perceptive narrative and incorruptible scrutiny in works that compel us to see the presence of suppressed histories

author: Imre Kertész
citation: for writing that upholds the fragile experience of the individual against the barbaric arbitrariness of history

author: J. M. Coetzee
citation: who in innumerable guises portrays the surprising involvement of the outsider

author: Elfriede Jelinek
citation: for her musical flow of voices and counter-voices in novels and plays that with extraordinary linguistic zeal reveal the absurdity of society's clichés and their subjugating power

author: Harold Pinter
citation: who in his plays uncovers the precipice under everyday prattle and forces entry into oppression's closed rooms

author: Orhan Pamuk
citation: who in the quest for the melancholic soul of his native city has discovered new symbols for the clash and interlacing of cultures

author: Doris Lessing
citation: that epicist of the female experience, who with scepticism, fire and visionary power has subjected a divided civilisation to scrutiny

author: J. M. G. Le Clézio
citation: author of new departures, poetic adventure and sensual ecstasy, explorer of a humanity beyond and below the reigning civilization

author: Herta Müller
citation: who, with the concentration of poetry and the frankness of prose, depicts the landscape of the dispossessed

author: Mario Vargas Llosa
citation: for his cartography of structures of power and his trenchant images of the individual's resistance, revolt, and defeat

author: Tomas Tranströmer
citation: because, through his condensed, translucent images, he gives us fresh access to reality

author: Mo Yan
citation: who with hallucinatory realism merges folk tales, history and the contemporary

author: Alice Munro
citation: master of the contemporary short story

author: Patrick Modiano
citation: for the art of memory with which he has evoked the most ungraspable human destinies and uncovered the life-world of the occupation

author: Svetlana Alexievich
citation: for her polyphonic writings, a monument to suffering and courage in our time

author: Bob Dylan
citation: for having created new poetic expressions within the great American song tradition

author: Kazuo Ishiguro
citation: who, in novels of great emotional force, has uncovered the abyss beneath our illusory sense of connection with the world

author: Olga Tokarczuk
citation: for a narrative imagination that with encyclopedic passion represents the crossing of boundaries as a form of life

author: Peter Handke
citation: for an influential work that with linguistic ingenuity has explored the periphery and the specificity of human experience.
